articles.headline: Fed Cuts Interest Rates by Another Quarter Point
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve cut rates for the second time since July as risks to the economic outlook mounted. Its policy continued to anger President Trump.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve cut rates for the second time since July as risks to the economic outlook mounted. Its policy continued to anger President Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve lowered interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point on Wednesday, its second cut since late July, and suggested it was prepared to move aggressively if the United States economy showed additional signs of weakening.

articles.headline: After a Divisive Israeli Election, Calls for Unity
articles.snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who tried to win on the strength of his right-wing and religious base, appears to have fallen short of a majority.
articles.abstract: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who tried to win on the strength of his right-wing and religious base, appears to have fallen short of a majority.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — The near-final results of Israel’s intensely fought election gave rise on Wednesday to a seemingly contradictory conclusion: While the country remains deeply divided, the forces of unity have gained an edge.
articles.byline: By David M. Halbfinger and Isabel Kershner

articles.headline: Wall Street Is Buzzing About Repo Rates. Here’s Why.
articles.snippet: Signs of stress have emerged in a key market that the financial system relies on every day.
articles.abstract: Signs of stress have emerged in a key market that the financial system relies on every day.
articles.lead_paragraph: Investors take for granted that the Federal Reserve controls interest rates. Rarely do they have to think about how.

articles.headline: Justin Trudeau Says He Is ‘Deeply Sorry’ After Brownface Photo Surfaces
articles.snippet: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s campaign was thrown into turmoil when a photograph surfaced of him in brownface makeup at a 2001 private school party.
articles.abstract: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s campaign was thrown into turmoil when a photograph surfaced of him in brownface makeup at a 2001 private school party.
articles.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA — The re-election campaign of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada was thrown into turmoil on Wednesday when a photograph surfaced of him wearing brownface makeup at a 2001 private school party.
articles.byline: By Ian Austen and Dan Bilefsky

articles.headline: A Trickle of Bodies at Ed Buck’s West Hollywood Home, Suspicion and an Arrest
articles.snippet: Mr. Buck finally faced consequences this week as prosecutors charged him with operating a drug house and accused him of being a predator who targeted vulnerable men.
articles.abstract: Mr. Buck finally faced consequences this week as prosecutors charged him with operating a drug house and accused him of being a predator who targeted vulnerable men.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the lifeless body of a 26-year-old man was found two years ago in the apartment of Ed Buck, a small-time Democratic donor and political activist, the authorities described it as an accidental overdose. Then, in January, a 55-year-old fashion consultant died in Mr. Buck’s home in exactly the same way. Once again, he faced no charges.
articles.byline: By Jose A. Del Real and Laura M. Holson

articles.headline: Fukushima Nuclear Disaster Trial Ends With Acquittals of 3 Executives
articles.snippet: The verdict makes it likely that no one will be held criminally responsible for the 2011 meltdown in Japan, which caused damage that could linger for generations.
articles.abstract: The verdict makes it likely that no one will be held criminally responsible for the 2011 meltdown in Japan, which caused damage that could linger for generations.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — A Japanese court on Thursday acquitted three former Tokyo Electric Power Company executives who had been accused of criminal negligence for their roles in the meltdown of the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant.
articles.byline: By Ben Dooley, Eimi Yamamitsu and Makiko Inoue

articles.headline: New Video Surfaces Showing Trudeau in Blackface, Compounding Scandal
articles.snippet: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada has cast himself as spokesman for the world’s liberals. But a series of episodes challenges that view.
articles.abstract: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada has cast himself as spokesman for the world’s liberals. But a series of episodes challenges that view.
articles.lead_paragraph: MONTREAL — Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada has long cast himself as a spokesman for the world’s liberals, standing up to President Trump, supporting women’s and Indigenous rights, welcoming immigrants and fighting climate change and racism.
articles.byline: By Dan Bilefsky and Ian Austen

articles.headline: Whistle-Blower Complaint Is Said to Involve Trump and Ukraine
articles.snippet: The complaint, from a member of the intelligence community, remained opaque but involved at least one of the president’s communications with a foreign leader.
articles.abstract: The complaint, from a member of the intelligence community, remained opaque but involved at least one of the president’s communications with a foreign leader.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A potentially explosive complaint by a whistle-blower in the intelligence community said to involve President Trump emerged on Thursday as the latest front in a continuing oversight dispute between administration officials and House Democrats.
articles.byline: By Julian E. Barnes, Nicholas Fandos, Michael S. Schmidt and Matthew Rosenberg
